title: The “Bight” Before Christmas and 2016 Key West Holiday Events

more_content:
Although the weather in Key West may not feel anything like Christmas, that doesn’t mean Key West doesn’t celebrate the season with the best of ‘em. In fact, you could argue that it’s Key West’s best season. The weather is impeccable. With highs in the mid-70s, tons of sunshine, and cool breezes, it’s the closest thing to heaven on earth and by far the best way to spend Christmas vacation. Collectively called the “Bight” Before Christmas, the local ensemble of holiday events might be a little unorthodox in some of its presentations, but none are lacking in Christmas cheer. That said, here are a few events to get you in the Christmas spirit:

Key West Harbor Walk of Lights
Through December 31, 2016. Lights at 6:00 p.m.
Lining the Key West Bight is the annual Harbor Walk of Lights. With Christmas trees made out of fishing traps and tackle, Santa, and jingles in the air, this is one place to peruse with a Christmas spirit in hand. The lights go on every night at 6:00 p.m. and Santa is always stationed at the nautical Christmas tree for pictures with you and your pets.

Lighted Boat Parade
Saturday, December 10, 2016 at 8:00 p.m.
In Key West, it just seems natural to decorate the boats with Christmas lights. For 26 years and counting, the Keys’ has been donning its finest decorations, floats and designs in front of the judges of Schooner Wharf Bar in the annual lighted boat parade. If you’re not planning on decorating your own boat, consider joining the party on one of Fury Water Sports catamarans. It’s the closest seat in the house.

Holiday Historic Inn Tours
Friday, December 9, 2016 at 6:00 p.m. & Friday, December 16, 2016 at 6:00 p.m.
What Key West lacks in snow, it makes up for in spirit during the Christmas season – especially during the Holiday Historic Inn Tours. Not only are these tours through some of Key West’s oldest inns, they’re also completely decorated from head to toe in Christmas lights and other holiday festivities. Grab the family and explore these historic homes while taking advantage of the “holiday cheer” that is always close by, i.e. Christmas treats and traditional beverages. Tickets are available through the official website.

Conch Republic Holiday Classic Car Show
Sunday, December 18, 2014, 12:00 – 4:00 p.m.
Another Key West holiday tradition, the Holiday Classic Car Show is back in front of the Conch Republic Seafood Company. Here you can see cars that go all the way back to the early 1900s, as well as some classic models you probably dreamed of owning as a kid. Hosted by the Southernmost Car Club, the show brings a shiny mix of antique, classic and exotic cars to Old Town Key West, all with some serious eye candy under the hood. Admission is free, but organizers ask that you bring a toy as a donation.
